tatami.simulation

Class SimulationManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • tatami.simulation.SimulationManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AgentManager

    public class SimulationManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements AgentManager
    Singleton class managing the simulation, visualization and agent control on a machine or on a set of machines (possibly all).

    After the initializations in Boot, it handles the actual starting and management of agents, as well as creating the events in the scenario timeline.

    It receives updates from all agents regarding logging messages and parent and location changes.

    The link with agents uses the agent's VisualizationComponent (or equivalent for non-CompositeAgent instances) and corresponding Vocabulary.

    It normally offers a GUI or some other kind of UI for the said operations, that can exist outside of the actual agent platform(s).

    Although not an agent of any platform, the SimulationManager can be viewed as an agent; for convenience, it implements AgentManager and it features a GUI based on AgentGui.

    This implementation presumes that Timer and related classes TimerTask are available on the execution platform.

    Author:
    Andrei Olaru

    • Constructor Detail

      • SimulationManager

        public SimulationManager(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,PlatformLoader> allPlatforms,
                 java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Boolean> allContainers,
                 java.util.Set<AgentCreationData> allAgents,
                 net.xqhs.util.XML.XMLTree.XMLNode timeline)
        Creates a new instance, also starting the GUI, based on the map of platforms and their names, the map of agents and their names (agents are managed by AgentManager wrappers and the timeline.
        Parameters:
        allPlatforms - - the Map of platform names and PlatformLoader instances that are currently started.
        allContainers - - the map of container names and information whether the container is created locally or remotely.
        allAgents - - a Set of AgentCreationData instances, describing all agents to be loaded.
        timeline - - the timeline of events, as XMLTree.XMLNode parsed from the scenario file.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public boolean start()
        Description copied from interface: AgentManager
        Starts the agent. If this goes well, from this moment on the agent should be executing normally.

        The method must guarantee that once it has been started, it can immediately begin to receive events, even if those events will not be processed immediately.

        Specified by:
        start in interface AgentManager
        Returns:
        true if the agent was started without error. false otherwise.

      • stop

        public boolean stop()
        Description copied from interface: AgentManager
        Stops the agent. After this method succeeds, the agent should not be executing any more.
        Specified by:
        stop in interface AgentManager
        Returns:
        true if the agent was stopped without error. false otherwise.

      • setPlatformLink

        public boolean setPlatformLink(PlatformLoader.PlatformLink link)
        As this class implements AgentManager only for convenience (abusing), it is not expected to be linked to a platform "above" it, therefore the method will have no effect and always fail.
        Specified by:
        setPlatformLink in interface AgentManager
        Parameters:
        link - - the link to the platform.
        Returns:
        true if the operation was successful. false otherwise.

        public java.lang.String getAgentName()
